pullRequest.body:
Show that the constant term of the Laurent series of Riemann zeta at s = 1 is the Euler-Mascheroni `Î³`.

---

nodes.body: @sgouezel Thank you for the review! I have pushed a new version addressing your comments.
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by MichaelStollBayreuth.

Thanks!

bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8731445984/job/23956854121)
bors r-
Canceled.

There is an error due the new names of various cast results. Can you please merge master and fix it? Thanks!

bors d+

:v: loefflerd can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8734695781/job/23965904600)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8734695781/job/23965903869)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8734695781/job/23965904164)
Looks great to me, thanks!

Maybe this fact, that `Î¶ s - 1 / (s - 1)` remains bounded in a neighborhood of `s=1` (that is, the input to the removable singularity theorem), could be isolated as a separate theorem? It can be useful in other contexts.

Sure! This precise statement isn't actually used in the proof (the version of removable-singularity that's used has an `o( (s - 1)^{-1})` hypothesis instead), but it can certainly be recovered from the stronger result that the function has a limit. I'll add it a as a separate lemma.

So, this turned out to be slightly less straightforward than I thought, owing to the need to juggle `ð“[â‰ ] (1 : â„‚)` and `ð“ (1 : â„‚)`. What do you think of the two lemmas I added to the file in my latest commit in order to handle this? If you think they're potentially useful, then I can relocate them to somewhere more appropriate in the mathlib hierarchy.
Looks good to me, thanks! And yes, the API lemmas seem useful to me; I would relocate them as you suggested.
My personal preference is to add docstrings to the "main" result of any section. (Feel free to ignore this suggestion.)
Same suggestion, to consider adding a docstring to this?

```suggestion
    term n 1
    _ = âˆ« x : â„ in n..(n + 1), (x - n) / x ^ 2 := by
```
So that the reader doesn't need to look around finding what you are computing.
Can you write down what you are computing?
I'm curious: given that the proof is `by rfl`, you still feel it is necessary to explicate the left `_`? Thanks!
Can you also fill in the right underscore here, to help your reader?

```suggestion
    Tendsto (fun (s : â„‚) â†¦ riemannZeta s - 1 / (s - 1)) (ð“[â‰ ] 1) (ð“ eulerMascheroniConstant) := by
```
Lean doesn't need it, but it can help your reader to see the difference with the previous lemma.
Can you move these two lemmas elsewhere (probably a file on asymptotics)? They have nothing specific to the Riemann zeta function.
Maybe add a `sub_one_div` or so in the name (it's not asymptotics of the zeta function itself...)?
Good point, thanks!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberTheory/Harmonic): asymptotics of Riemann zeta as s â†’ 1
